pros: Horizon is an agency that constantly strives to take care of their employees: Wages, benefits, retirement, work-life balance.
cons: Health care is demanding. Post COVID has added new challenges.

pros: Employees usually get a year end bonus.
cons: Profit driven versus patient care driven.

pros: Great Therapy supervisor. Great orientation process.
cons: Salary was below average. Mileage reimbursement was poor. Communication from office and other staff less than ideal

job_title: Home Care Aide in Oak Creek, WI
pros: Director and educators were kind and professional
cons: Fellow nursing staff and a few office staff were rude, not welcoming, went out of their way to avoid helping. I asked to not have my photo displayed and they displayed it. I was told to meet my new preceptor at 9am. Got to meeting place and she was no where to be found and would never give me the address to any location and instead had me race to keep up with her in my car in traffic as she whipped in and out of traffic. The nurse training me never paused to demonstrate or let me practice. After five weeks I made choice to go elsewhere. Nursing feild is short staff and if their staff wants to be a rude about it they can be over worked instead of being nice and helping the new person.

pros: Clinicians were great, very knowledgeable, helpful, supportive and cared about their patients.
cons: Management not receptive to feedback for how to make company more desirable to work for, or receptive to feedback for improvement. Management asked for input but eventually nothing changed. No shared governance option. No compensation for mandatory meetings. High turnover especially for nurses.

pros: Thorough onboarding. The more experienced PTs are helpful and collaborative. High level of independence.
cons: EMR software is slightly difficult/frustrating and isn't "live" for field staff.

job_title: Medical Social Worker in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Medium Autonomy, that’s all that was positive
cons: Minimal training/leadership guidance. Poor work life balance. Limited support.

pros: The schedule is very flexible
cons: Boring patient population, hours of paperwork. Management (way things are run)

job_title: Home Hospice RN Case Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Flexibility, patient base, travel, manager
cons: Very busy, tight chart deadlines

pros: Supportive co-workers, great pay, flexible
cons: Not sure what to put for cons.

review_title: The Work Culture is the Best!!
pros: Support and Resources are over the top! Great orientation!! Magnificent RN Educators.
cons: Benefits are expenssive. You earn your own Short Term Disability. Mileage is paid oncer per month and is a little on the lower end. You have to pay for your Horizon only uniforms which are dark purple & it comes out of your paycheck. But some of the benefits outweigh what you don't get in $, such as your work phone can also be your personal phone for only $25.00 per month unlimited everything! They also have a gym close by that you have free membership to. Tons of discounts.

job_title: Insurance Verification Specialist in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great company to work for overall
cons: The compensation for employees would be a great incentive

pros:
Compassionate
Great Company to work for
cons: Nothing really negative to say about this company

job_title: Meals On Wheels Volunteer in Milwaukee, WI
pros: I can speak to the supervisors about anything with ease, everyone is friendly
cons: not much interaction between the rest of the volunteers

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Racine, WI
pros: Friendly staff, good environment to work in.
cons: Not enough work for LPNS

pros: In this day and age, I seldom hear of employees who feel truly invested to the organizations they work for. Linked in a personal way which connects and drives one to a higher level of accomplishment both personally and as a team. A place where kinship comes naturally.  A place to foster relationships with those we invest so much of our lives, all profoundly connected to the vision of not only caring for the people of our community, but with a personal touch. Understanding our patients and families, delivering thoughtful and quality health care in a rapidly expanding market. I am blessed to work with terrific motivated people. True professionals, friends and leadership expending immense energy into sustaining and growing positive outcomes.
cons: None currently come to mind.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Mequon, WI
pros: The caring atmosphere on the hospice unit by all the staff. The R.N.'s and L.P.N.'s provide clear direction for their staff , display true affection for the people and families they serve. Couldn't have asked for better supervision in this health care field.
cons:
Upper management could appreciate their nursing staff more.
Increases in pay would be helpful for all positions.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great patients, great co-workers that are supportive and helpful!
cons: Poor management and consistently understaffed.

job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Milwaukee, WI
pros: The company is growing and thriving. I am learning while at work that is truly the best! Horizon really cares about their employees!!
cons: I have not experienced any cons working with Horizon Home Care and Hospice.

pros: Great hospice manager, wonderful team of nurses, social workers, chaplaincy, and secretaries.  Felt very supported.
cons: At the time, wage compensation was not up to standard, but along with health care and other perks related to Horizon, was fair.

job_title: Home Health Aide in Milwaukee, WI
pros: An ideal environment for those who enjoy one on one quality care.
cons: Sometimes the time spent with the clients and family is much too short!

pros: The best reason to work there is the independence you have. The patients were my reason for staying.
cons: Terrible management. Low pay. Overworked. No appreciation.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Management is great, works with you to improve job performance. Excellent Director of Clinical Nursing and staff.  All staff easy to get along with.
cons: Lower pay than most

pros: Mission driven, care for employees translates to great care for patients!
cons: Can always use more staff as we are a growing agency.

pros: Great people, managers very helpful
cons: Hard dealing with insurances, but that’s really not the company’s fault. Too much charting , but again, not Horizons fault.
